intro: Masdevallia sulphurea, commonly known as the sulphur masdevallia, is a rare and striking orchid native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow and orange flowers, which are often adorned with intricate patterns of red and brown. The plant typically grows as a small, terrestrial orchid with a pseudobulb and narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in cool, humid environments with high altitude and partial shade. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is often cultivated in specialized orchid collections.
